 Well, just for the record, you see it wrong. Americans are guaranteed certain rights by the constitution. The Establishment Clause of the First Amendment prohibits government from endorsing or supporting religion, even the most popular religion. The Free Exercise Clause prevents the government from outlawing or seriously burdening a person's pursuit of whatever religion he chooses. Both clauses have been incorporated against the states under the due process clause of the 14th Amendment. That means that the prohibitions of the Constitution apply to state governments and divisions thereof as well.
 
 Since teachers are agents of the state by virtue of their position, they are prohibited from endorsing or supporting religion in their class rooms. Teachers can and have lost their jobs over the issue. And the Supreme Courts have declared that prayer as part of official school events constitute an establishment of religion.
